Scope and form: Lectures, industry presentations, group exercises in teams of 6 students
Type of assessment:
Oral examination
Oral exam with pitch of data visualization During the semester, a small pilot project is prepared in teams of 6 students, which is presented as an explanatory data visualization. The visualization is handed in at the end of the semester (before the end of the 13 weeks) and brought to the exam, where the pilot project is pitched. Each group member presents their contributions. All group members are then examined individually in the syllabus based on the questions the pitch gives rise to. The explanatory data visualization is accounts for 25%, the pitch for 25%, and the subsequent oral examination for 50% in the overall assessment.
Exam duration: Oral exam for 45 minutes (6 students), including pitch for a maximum of 12 minutes. The data visualization included in the pitch is submitted in advance in A1 format with a maximum of 450 words.

General course objectives:
General course objectives
The general purpose of the course is to qualify the student to understand and handle problems and opportunities in data analysis projects from a management perspective. The student will be able to identify and assess challenges in connection with the commercial and organizational value of data projects as well as challenges in connection with their implementation, including collection, analysis and visualization of data, involved, processes, technology and organization. In this regard, there will be a special focus on communicating the results and prerequisites of data projects, including various strategies for data visualization and involvement of stakeholders, as well as translation of the data project's potential to the business context of the company or organization in question. As a team, the students must be able to find solutions to identified challenges and communicate them clearly in a management perspective.
Learning objectives:
A student who has met the objectives of the course will be able to:
analyze challenges and opportunities in a specific data analysis project
identify the project's stakeholders
define the project's commercial value
compare and assess potential pitfalls and barriers for the project
develop a realistic and well-thought-out plan for the implementation of the project in a concrete company
visualize the project's prerequisites, processes and results.
discuss the project's possible consequences for the market and organisation.
design a strategy for the involvement of actors who are relevant to the implementation and impact of the project
prepare a presentation of the project's opportunities and challenges to senior management
communicate the project's results and relevance to the company's business in clear and well-argued language
Content: The role of data analysis projects in different organizational contexts. Challenges in connection with the implementation of data analysis projects in companies. Different types of data visualization and strategies for their use. Different theories about data and the effects of data analysis on markets and organizations. Involvement of stakeholders in analyses of data. Assessment of the business value of data projects. Discussion of data quality issues. Typical data analysis process models. Technological challenges. Analysis of actors. Data analysis strategy. Discussions, articles and mini-cases will give participants the opportunity to discuss individual aspects of management challenges and solutions. Within a project based on a case study, participants will apply their knowledge in a team and deliver solutions.
